website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty molding compound - more of a paste than a clay - from a trusted brand in hair care.
pros: Perfect for active men or those who sweat heavily
Offers a shine-free finish and a long-lasting hold
cons: The most gluey option on our list
May be too dense for thin hair

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for East-Asian hair
customer_reviews.text: Terrible hair product. If you are East-Asian with straight thick black hair, stay away from this like the plague. It leaves residue in the hair and the hair doesn't stay put - no matter how much you use. Very disappointed in the product. The only good thing about this product is that it is easy to clean which is only useful when you realize that it is no good and just makes your hair sticky.
customer_reviews.author: Dav C

customer_reviews.title: Works like gel without the shine or smell
customer_reviews.text: I've used a bunch of different things including gel, mousse, spray and wax. They all have downfalls like making your head look like a plastic hard hat, weird smells or feeling like you dumped glue on your head. This stuff does none of that and your hair feels like hair only it stays where you want it to stay.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best hair product I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best hair product I have ever used. I have thick curly/wavy hair and I hate using pomade or anything shiny in my hair. It just doesn't fit my style. This clay helps shape my hair and keep it in place. That whole..."bedhead look but you know its on purpose" look. I will continue to get this overtime I need some clay. It smells great too!
customer_reviews.author: adam bullet

customer_reviews.title: Smell is just as bad as the hold
customer_reviews.text: The smell of this stuff reminds me of walking into my great-aunt Sally’s trailer who smokes 3 packs of Marlboros a day. The hold is awful, especially if your hair is thick. If you try and rub your fingers through your hair, this stuff will come right out by noon. It takes a big finger full in order for it to get any sort of hold, so you end up using a lot. I don’t think I’ve ever left a negative review, but I dislike this stuff so much that I felt compelled to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff - not a gelled look, but a natural one!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is GREAT! My husband uses it, and he has very thick hair that is hard to style. It seems to work for him. I also use it for my two little boys who have finer hair, and it's terrific - it doesn't look greasy or shiny, and leaves the hair VERY pliable. I don't like the feel of typical gel in hair because it gets all crispy, but this clay doesn't do that. I will definitely be buying it again. You need to use more when you have coarser hair, but finer hair doesn't need very much!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff for short or longer hair
customer_reviews.text: I have longer hair (6-7in) in an undercut style. The clay is easy to work through hair with minimal pulling. Restyles easily throughout the day with a comb. Leaves my hair very light and non-greasy. Only complaint is that I work 12hr shifts on my feet most of the time and it doesn't seem to quite make it to the end of the day. Might need to re-up near the end or something. Used a lot of various products ( Woodys clay, LayRite cement, Crew Fiber, De Fugo Claymation) but keep coming back to this to compare them the value and performance is great.
customer_reviews.author: MrSlippery

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and effort.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money, it does the opposite of what you expect a moulding clay or dry wax is supposed to do. I was having skin issues on my face, so thought of using a comparatively expensive product for my hair styling. I read good reviews on Amazon and gave it a try. 1) It doesn't give any hold to the hair at all. The creamy paste is too soft and absorbed by the hair leaving them having no hold. 2) Your hair doesn't get the stiffness and also they shine (unlike matte finish)
customer_reviews.author: Nabil

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great clay product. I use it often and I have fine hair that sometimes gets all wavy if I grow it out. It's able to control my hair without giving me that helmet head Pomade look or greased looking style. It looks really natural and gives the less covered spots of my hair more volume haha. Highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: pork_steak

customer_reviews.title: If you have dark hair, be careful with the end result.
customer_reviews.text: I got this product based on the reviews, I've been using pomade for the last 8 years, I wanted something not so shinny but still good hold, so I decided to try it. First t I tried and rubbed it hard on my hands very hard to disolve it. I massage it into my hair and when I combed it I can see this little almost sand looking grains everywhere, I figured I needed to work it a little harder on my hands, second time I tried it, I really put some elbow grease into it, but I got the same result. So maybe my batch wasn't mixed properly/thoroughly when packaged but I can use this product.
customer_reviews.author: JAg

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the right product to give my hair the messy beach look and discovered this product on Amazon.. reading the reviews convinced me but... man... reviews aren't everything. Used the minimal amount after letting my hair dry after a shower with some good results. But after an hour or so checking in the mirror... my hair was flat! I washed all the product out and reapplied to see if using x3 more would work but the same result is what I got. Definitely not recommended for a messy surfer beach look... maybe for shorter hair but idk.. I went with a spray and pray with this.
customer_reviews.author: K.Noble

customer_reviews.title: Should Be Called Stiff & Hard
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and this product came up a few times in various articles. I was excited to try it out. I had been using Fiber by Crew and it's done it's job but just wanted to try something new as my hair got longer. With this product, if I used only a little, my hair didn't hold and was super stiff (almost like a slightly better version of gel). If I used slightly more than the recommended amount then my hair was felt crunchy and basically like gel. I wouldn't buy this unless you are looking for a next generation gel. Just know, it's not smooth. Don't believe the name...
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Cyrus

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hair care product yet. Plus they send you a freebie!
customer_reviews.text: I've used premium gel and cream before. They all worked fine, but the cream specifically can be tough to mix in your hair without getting chunks and it's pretty difficult to wash off your hands. But this styling clay is probably my best purchase yet in regards to hair styling products. It's very malleable and doesn't get chunky. The texture reminds me of silly putty, actually. This is definitely my favorite hair care product so far. BONUS: They also include an insert with directions to a survey on the product and you get to choose a free product of theirs. Completely free, you don't even pay shipping. Pretty cool of them!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! I've bought countless comparable products, even some recommended by my haircutter and this product beats all of them. I have very fine, thin hair, shaved on the sides with more on top, and one container has lasted me exactly a year, according to Amazon. I like that it makes my hair look fuller and it's easy to get off of my hands when I'm done. No greasy residue or flakes in my hair either. I did some survey for them when I bought my first container and they rewarded me with a full-size container of another one of their products. I haven't bothered to use it yet, this stuff does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Irving

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for about a month now, and I've found it underwhelming. I've always wanted to try this product due to its ratings, but it's been a "meh" experience. I like the matte finish, but it definitely hasn't had a strong enough hold for me personally. It's not the worst hair product I've used, but not the best. It looks and does okay for like the first hour, but anything after that, especially if my day involves any physical activity, my hair starts to droop and ends up in my face.
customer_reviews.author: Billy K

customer_reviews.title: Product is Hard As A Rock!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why this product is so popular. I had to get a knife to remove some of the product from the jar for use. I even tried to heat it to make it more pliable. When applied to my hair, it was all clumpy and inconsistent. Smooth Viking does have a Satisfaction Guarantee, so hopefully I'll be able to find a product that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Nice, not as strong hold as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough product, and good value BUT it really isn't strong at all. I would compare the strength to a forming cream, not a pomade or wax. I used it on towel dried short hair (2" length hair, hand-combed side part), and I had to use way more than I wanted to in order to get my hair to sit. I think I'll go back to using Muk. More expensive but requires far less product. If you have hair that just requires a bit of light hold and texture then this might work for you but unfortunately it doesn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael_Inc

customer_reviews.title: Really weak hold, but maybe better for shorter hair?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to spread throughout hair and hands, but the hold is really lacking. The top of my hair is about 4-5 inches long and I style it into a comb over/pompadour style, but I noticed using this it fails to hold any sort of volume throughout the day. My hair becomes flat and if there is any sort of wind, the style will just not hold with this product. It is easy to wash out so that is a positive, but everything else about this just doesn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I am relatively new to styling my hair (buzz cut for 20 years). i tried a few products, did some research as to what i wanted and landed on hair clay being my desired "product line". After trying a few hair clay products, this one worked the best for me, had no noticeable scent, and is very easy to use/cleanup/remove. i just bought my second container and will probably keep buying. well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Blueyerish

customer_reviews.title: One star
customer_reviews.text: This product looks and feels really good but it has horrible hold. I bought it to have something with a little bit of hold on it but it is terrible for that
customer_reviews.author: AlexSuperT

customer_reviews.title: Odin would be proud!
customer_reviews.text: Recently I’ve been trying all types of hair products for men. I’ve tried high-end, designer brands to all the clays, pastes and pomades you can find any your local drugstore. In the end, I think Smooth Viking’s clay is a great choice. Reasonably priced with great hold. Easy to apply and wash out. Feels good on your hair (not tacky). The odor is a little earthy at first but dissipates in seconds. I intend to make Smooth Viking my standard!
customer_reviews.author: citizen

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try another hair clay and was confident in this product based upon the reviews it has received. However, this turned out to be less similar to the clay products that I have been accustomed to. This is closer to a wax paste (see the ingredients) rather than a thickening clay. For this reason I am disappointed. Everything about the packaging and the brand otherwise seemed very appealing. Just not what I was looking for. For reference, my hair is thicker, more dry than oily. I typically use Redken Clay pomade or Baxter California's clay.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't feel like a clay hair product
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't call this a clay, its more like putty or forming cream. I need to use clay products on my hair because I have very thick hair but this stuff is too weak for me, the hold doesn't last long. In order for this to work on my hair I had to use a lot of product which ended up making my hair look greasy, Overall I would say if you don't have thick unmanageable hair, this would work for you but even so, this is not a clay product in my opinion/experience.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Has a mustache on the front, Not good for Mustache or hair.
customer_reviews.text: It's a thick white paste. When I put it in my mustache, it pretty much stays there. I have to rub out most of it to get the white out, otherwise, it looks like I have, ya know, white residue above my mouth. And then when I put it in my hair, it sticks. Then it's like getting peanut butter in my hair. Would not recommend. And what's worse is that there is no return on this. Extremely disappointed in this product, company, and Amazon for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gosei

customer_reviews.title: Was a little disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to try this clay/cream out and I found it to be a bit of a disappointment. I found this stuff is really thick and difficult to spread. Also, the hold was a little too firm for me, and uneven, again, from being thick and hard to spread. I've become a big Mitch fan, and even prefer basic "Dove" products over this one. Just my opinion though, to each their own.
customer_reviews.author: The Tenneys

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work, hold is not very strong
customer_reviews.text: I have thick and wavy hair (although I keep it short) and this stuff doesn't hold it very well. It works into the hair easily but that's about the only positive. It also occasionally leaves tiny particles in my hair and kind of makes it look like I have dandruff. They are very small so not very noticeable. This may be a result of me using a lot of the product to try to get my hair to stay in the shape I want.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold for more than an hour
customer_reviews.text: Leaves white film in my hair and it's extremely noticeable. I have only found one other product that does this. Doesn't hold my hair for more than an hour before it starts to fail. I work in a professional setting and need to look my best. I'll have to keep looking for something that works better for me.
customer_reviews.author: jpizano

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: this does not have the substance of clay like other clay products. i still personally prefer woodys clay. purchased this because of the reviews but it looks like people where compensated for leaving a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: A. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it..
customer_reviews.text: In past I have used Aveda Grooming Clay. I thought I would give this a try and save $12. This styling clay is a bit more rubbery and not as creamy clay as is the Aveda Clay so does not spread as easy. Do not get me wrong, it is not like a fiber gel, but not smooth clay either. It does have a pleasant smell which some of these things do not.
customer_reviews.author: henrycpa91

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt recommend it for any hair.
customer_reviews.text: The description states its strong hold and i need a strong hold for my hair as its long and thick. I do a messy hair style and this doesnt have a hold or anything. It left my hair flat and with a wierd finish on it. I give them props on giving it a good smell,but Axe Matt Finish Waz works the best for me. I wouldnt recommend it for anything with volume,maybe can work for slicked back hair.
customer_reviews.author: Juan P.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few different hair products, many are either too thick, or too watery, or too shellac like, or too shiny, but this clay seems to hit the sweet spot just in the middle of all of it. It spreads well with slightly damp hair, so only a few dabs will cover the entire head, has a firm but slightly bouncy hold, matte so you can't see your reflection in it, and a decent neutral smell to it. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. King

customer_reviews.title: Not a strong hold, not a good smell.
customer_reviews.text: This clay is not what I expected at all. I am a male with basically a short pomp hairstyle and this does not cut it. I looked for this product because of the reviews, the "Strong Hold", and the price point. I went from using a medium hold clay to this and the hold got significantly worse. This clay, no matter how much I use, does not keep my hair up for more than 15 minutes at a time without me having to brush it back up. On top of that, it really does not smell pleasant so it makes me self conscious that I smell bad. Overall disappointed and was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Will Adie

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for Boogie's Styling Clay from Dollar Shave Club. This item is not it. Less of a clay and more of a cream, low sheen finish but a light-medium hold. Disappointed in the lack of hold as it was advertised for being "strong". The product is close to a matte finish therefore 2 stars. Look elsewhere for a replacement to your favorite styling clay. This product seems to be of decent quality if you are looking for a medium-hold cream.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, smells good.
customer_reviews.text: Gel user for years I decided to try something new out. I was tired of getting my hair wet before applying gel to it, specially in the mornings when time is limited. This clay works great with wet or dry hair, smells good and not mess at all. I am reviewing this product in exchange for a gift but regardless I love it and I will not be using gel anymore after discovering the Hair Styling Clay.
customer_reviews.author: askfortamn45y

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hair product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst hair product I have ever used. If your looking for a good hair clay I would much rather recommend the axe brand. This stuff is garbage. It arrived and was solid as a rock, it smelled terrible, and was completely unusable. I honestly would have had better use with a can of poop.
customer_reviews.author: The Dreadbug

customer_reviews.title: It's Alright
customer_reviews.text: It's just a clay, nothing great to be said about it. It's a bit lumpy, but not terrible. The scent is a little chemical-y to me, but it is VERY light. You basically won't smell it at all. I'm used to home-brewed hair stylers so this one was kind of something I bought because I'm traveling and needed something small and would arrive quickly. It's not great but not bad. But they won't take it away at the airport so it has that going for it. Emulsifies pretty easily and is a matte finish. I can't comment on the hold however because I keep my hair down and go for a fringe/disheveled look.
customer_reviews.author: dz

customer_reviews.title: Better than pomade
customer_reviews.text: I like this stuff a lot. You can't tell that there's any product in your hair and it holds really well. I have thick, wavy hair that I get cut on the shorter side and it does a great job. It doesn't run when I sweat and gives me an all day hold. I've tried several pomades but I don't care for the overly styled appearance. I recommend this to anyone not into the high shine, trying too hard look but wants a product that still gives them a strong hold while leaving the hair feeling soft.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Kitzis

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad. Did not have the hold I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: This product smells bad. The smell reminds of me of the smell of baby wipes. it also did not have the hold I need for my already thick hair. It made my hair feel very tangly. I bought this to see what clay was like, but I will go back to my pomade.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Tom

customer_reviews.title: Clay for the Modern Man
customer_reviews.text: I've been shopping around for the right clay for my hair for quite awhile...In the process, I've tried around 8-10 products. This is by far the best. This clay leaves no clumps or mess in your hair. No weird sheen that you might get with waxes and some clays. Very clean and solid hold for clay. The scent is also solid. I've found that this stuff is easy. Nice matte finish. I've also noticed that it provides a much more natural look to my hair when styled. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robinhood

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell and cannot return. Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s ridiculous that I cannot return this. The smell is horrible and very perfumey like for a woman. Beware that you cannot return these this if u don’t like it, even though it is an Amazon prime item. Pretty sneaky. not happy about this!
customer_reviews.author: Jayson K

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Pros: product works very well to hold short (1-3in) in place for a day or two. Product applies easily, doesn't have a very strong odor, and cleans off of your hands pretty easily. Cons: product dries out and becomes much harder to spread. If you don't use much and you don't apply it often, it loses a lot of its moisture and tends to pull pretty hard when applied. Product does have a scent but it is mold and I can smell it once applied. If your hair gets wet from rain or sweat, this will lose its hold pretty quickly and easily.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Selfors

customer_reviews.title: Good hold, true matte finish with no shine.
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, the first time I tried the product I didn't like it at all. It was very different from what I have used in the past (I've never used a clay until now). Now that I've been using it for a couple of weeks, I'm in love with it. The smell is great and not too strong. I love the matte finish (seriously, there's no shine) because I hate the shiny, crusty look. I always use a hair dryer to style my hair after this is applied, and it really helps with the strong hold.
customer_reviews.author: Nate I.

customer_reviews.title: Feels Like Glue
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I could be storing mine in too low a temperature or maybe I got a bad batch, but this stuff feels like glue and somehow still has almost no hold. The stuff is so sticky I have to be really careful when running it through my hair to the roots, because it always pulls some out. Wild! I was hoping this would be a bit more like Dirty, the hair cream by Lush. Don't get turned off these kinds of products if this specific one isn't working for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good styling clay.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a clay for my short hair and so far, I like this product. I know it's a men's product, but it works for me to style my hair. I tried other products, but they don't work as well as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tinabop187

customer_reviews.title: but now have my favorite product in the arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I've used many styling products, preferring the mat type. I go between Aveda clay and American Crew fiber, but now have my favorite product in the arsenal. Smooth Viking has a pleasant, masculine, somewhat minty smell. It goes on light but has great style coaxing without the appearance of something in my hair. Drawbacks are it's 2 oz container and it's a little more expensive than AC fiber. With that said, I think it's worth the extra cost and I'll continue to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: michael m

customer_reviews.title: Great hold without getting stiff or sticky.
customer_reviews.text: I'm always on the lookout for new product. I have thick hair but I like to use as little product as possible. A lot of products that are strong enough to tame it are also either like glue or they get stiff. It's not the 80's and I'm not looking for the "wet look". I decided to give Smooth Viking a try and I'm glad I did. It has the perfect balance for my hair. It will hold it in place but you can still run your fingers through it.
customer_reviews.author: RS in TX

customer_reviews.title: Very poor hold for long hair or Humid weather
customer_reviews.text: This clay doesnt hold well for hair thats longer than 4 inches, it will keep losing shape. It takes a while for the clay to completely dry and give you a proper hold once its applied. Once it is dry, hair strands will gradually lock out of the clay and you are left with a bunch of random hairstrands out of place. Do not use this in humid weather, it cant resist humidity at all, even light humidity. Your hair will be completely flat by the end of a humid day.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had a better scent, but I liked the hold & look ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had a better scent, but I liked the hold & look so much, I used Smooth Viking Styling Clay on my wedding night! It was an outdoor beach wedding in Cancun, and it held up in the heat & humidity on the dance floor all night without issues! Only wish it had a "manlier" scent, and not so clean/sanitary smelling. Something more outdoorsy, like pine, sandalwood, or pipe tobacco. Other than the smell (which isn't awful by any means), this product works fantastic! Will definitely use again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Monolith123

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable product..healthy/natural look👍👍
customer_reviews.text: From my brief but elaborate experience with hair clay, i must say this stuff rocks. Very well blended and balanced. Results...natural looking/clean drydown. **I repeat..this product is great if you want a natural look!! Definitely not the heavier oily type of clay that I’ve seen in Rudy’s, Baxter, or Seattle Pomade Co, etc(?) This is more similar to Arcadian or Reuzel clays..
customer_reviews.author: Vinny Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Styling Clay!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works well, holds, and doesn't leave a greasy look or anything. My only complaint is it doesn't wash out as easily as claimed. They say just water and it comes out easily but even with shampoo it still took 4 days of shampooing and very thorough running water through it to finally get all of it out the first time I used it. Using a bit less it takes usually 2 days to get most of it out. Not a horrible problem and certainly not going to detract from my 5 star rating of the product. I was impressed, overall.
customer_reviews.author: Xengre

customer_reviews.title: It's really not bad but not good.
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad if you have thin hair. I have really thick asian hair and its not strong enough for my type of hair. I don't think its a bad product. Just not as strong of a hold as it claims to be. There are better products that worked for me that claim the same deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dora Chau

customer_reviews.title: Great for long thick unruly hair
customer_reviews.text: My hair takes a lot of conditioning (leave in conditioner as well) and to keep it controlled I typically use a pea size amount and work it in throughout. I then use my fingers to style it in place and they use a bit more on the areas that aren't controlled. I may add a hair spray to futher hold it, however I typically don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: PaulR

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but lackluster hold
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I did enjoy the clay for what it was due to the value. However, it's marketed as a clay with a strong hold and that wasn't the case for me. Everyone's hair is different, but I've used quite a few products from other brands and the hold was more 'medium'. I felt I had to use too much of the product to get a decent hold, but even then I'd lose a decent amount of hold throughout the day. For reference I've been using American Crew Fiber for quite some time before I tried the Smooth Viking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Weak hold for a clay, strong fragrance
customer_reviews.text: Definitely does not have a hold strong enough for me to really consider this a clay. It's honestly more like a fiber or paste with a medium hold. The fragrance is also very strong and does not go away throughout the day. You can't really smell it until you've warmed it and applied it to your hair, so I would recommend trying it out on a day when you can wash it out if you don't like it. With that said, it's still a good product for anyone looking for a weaker hold and a matte finish.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not for all scalps
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before getting this. It works well as a hair styling product, but if I use it for a few days it starts to irritate my scalp and cause dandruff. Edit: Unsure why my review is hidden by the "sensitivity" filter
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Magic clay that disappears and does nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Almost like wearing nothing at all??? So... does this just disappear into your hair? I can’t get it to do anything. I’ve tried using more... I still have to use hairspray on top... going back to fiber.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not enough hold and poor pliability
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to work smooth enough to get into the hair, and doesn't hold well enough. Too much is needed to get any decent hold, which then adds too much weight and brings it back down. Catch-22. This was recommended by Smooth Viking customer service as the replacement for their sadly discontinued spiked-up hair rubber, but it's nowhere close. Smooth Viking no longer has any product worth my consideration.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. It left my hair with a chalky tinged film, it wasn’t shapeable when applied damp or dry, and I still had to use hairspray for fuzz control. Plus it made my head itch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, excellent hold with matte finished.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I’ve been using this product for maybe the past two years now and I use nothing else. It’s seriously the only hair product I care to use from now on. Original: For the longest time I have been searching for a product that has a strong hold, no shine, and doesnt make me feel like I just put glue in my hair. This is that product. It is the absolute number one hair product I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Alek Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product and definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is among the best in budget products. It's easily comparable to others worth twice as much. Scent: Not a strong scent but it is fairly masculine albeit slightly chemically (but not so much as to make it unpleasant). Hold: Mid to Strong flexible hold and easy to restyle with a bit of water reactivation. Application: Very easy. It's smooth to take out and spreads easy in the hands. Finish: Really does add a decent amount of texture and volume to hair and it retains a very natural looking matte finish. Overall a great reliable product that is easy to work with and wash out. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Supreme King Z-ARC

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for blonde hair
customer_reviews.text: About 30 mins after application, a white powder covered my hair. Didn't look like dandruff, just looked like someone threw a pinch of matte flour on my hair. Then, when I got into my car, single hairs started to split from the way I styled my hair. It looked like I had some static charge. Another hair product joining the corner of my med cabinet for when I don't need to look as good. Also, the free gift site wouldn't accept my purchase. I used the same email.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I had to switch to a new brand after my old brand was discontinued. I have been pleasantly surprised with this hair clay. My only wish is that the smell was improved!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Lawn

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The styling clay styles my hair just the way I want. It doesn’t leave a film or hard dry like a lot of products. In fact, it doesn’t look like I have anything in my hair, but I can obtain the hair style that I like. Good product. It has a little bit of a smell when you get it out of the container, but it seems odorless when applied to hair.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Toone

customer_reviews.title: Good scent, easy to spread
customer_reviews.text: Works well with thin hair. It's pretty easy to spread. It's not to thick either which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S

customer_reviews.title: High hold matte finish
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a high hold, matte finish product and this styling clay has exactly what I need. Whether I blow dry my hair for volume or just use it to comb my hair it lasts all day and leaves no shine. A little goes a long way and so far it's lasted me longer than other hair clays. I would highly recommend this clay over more expensive, bigger brand hair products.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not high enough hold
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent product but I would not say it is a firm or high hold. This is more of a medium hold. It does have a matte finish and washes out easily. It's not enough of a hold for my short and thick hair so I'll be sticking with American Crew Fiber for now.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way!
customer_reviews.text: I am a creature of habit and when I find something that works for me, I just pray that Smooth Viking will still be around when I'm in my 80's. I have somewhat thinning short hair and this product really gives me the lift and fullness that I need. The clay texture of the product gives me the matte finish that I love without making it look and feel greasy. There are many products that I have tried and that are still under my bathroom sink unused because Smooth Viking is my new go to. Get it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Adds texture and pliability without being greasy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Adds texture and pliability without being greasy or too wet. Only takes a little to easily work with. Have tried several products over the years and can readily say that this is the best I've found. Again...great product! Received a promotional item called "Spiked Rubber". I had thought that the Smooth Viking Styling Clay was the last product I would ever need/want. This promo item was fantastic! I want more! It works especially well when my hair is shorter...after a haircut or just a shorter style. Love it! It goes in so easily, works in well, feels light through the day, and is very manageable. Got to keep this item available!! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Don Miller

customer_reviews.title: Made my hair very dry.
customer_reviews.text: Product came on time with great package, But I do not recommend this product because it make you hair very dry and sticky. I have normal hair, I think this product is specific for only very smooth and silky hair. There is no possibility to return the product otherwise I would have return it.
customer_reviews.author: tartouk

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for thin hair
customer_reviews.text: Works well for guys with thin hair like me. I’ve had several comments that my hair seems thicker than when I used other products. Blow dry on cool and apply a nickel sized piece to the palm and emulsify. Just make sure it’s rubbed in enough to not still look grey. Decent hold but I still finish off with a bit of hairspray if I’m going to be outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a comparable replacement for Boogie's Hair Clay from Dollar Shave Club as it has been discontinued. The reviews for this are SPECTACULAR. It is a very disappointing product as it is more 'wax' textured than 'clay'. It's heavy on the hair and does not hold very well. Stray hairs get away all the time unless you use a lot to cover. This leads to your style feeling weighed down and makes your hair look wet / greasy. The people that love this just haven't tried Boogie's Hair Clay or a better product that's a true hair clay. The matte finish is more semi-gloss than matte.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Made my fiancé’s hair look worse than before. There are other products that work better than this for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Memory

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, this was one of several palmaids I bought to try and this is the best. It is not shiny at all in my hair. I have thining hair and this makes my hair look fuller (once dried). I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Royib812

customer_reviews.title: This Product Doesn't Work As Described
customer_reviews.text: The jar says "Styling Clay" and there's nothing clay about it. It has a weak hold, which is not surprising because the clay is watery, not clayy. Unfortunately I cannot receive a refund from this product. If you're reading this Smooth Viking, please refund me my money. If you want a great styling clay, purchase The Cardinal Brand High Shine Wax. This product is amazing, it's just a little expensive, which is why I tried the Smooth Viking.
customer_reviews.author: Rotty's

customer_reviews.title: Too little product for too much price.
customer_reviews.text: The box it comes in is double the size. 2 oz of this thick stuff is enough for I don’t know, a week if you’re a guy with shoulder length hair? It’s way too expensive and not actually effective enough on thick, wavy hair in small amounts.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Very weak and doesn't last!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this product. Weak hold and doesn't style well with my hair - I know this is subjective and depends on what hair has and style a person prefers. However, the reason this product gets a one star is that within two hours my hair looks totally different from how I styled it, almost frizzy, no separation. With quality products, hair stays similar to how a person styles it throughout the day. This lasts no more than two hours. What's the point? Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Doc808

customer_reviews.title: Why is this like a solid?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try something new for my hair and I got this product. However, it is really like solid. Nearly impossible to rub it on my hands and dissolve it. Pamade product from Viking seems to be a much better than this one. Amazon also does not let me return this product after 3 weeks. I have to go over the return policy. Waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Not a "strong hold" at all.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Smooth Viking products in the past, most of which are excellent, but this one just isn't strong at all. It says "strong hold" but it isn't even close. It's a good product for adding a bit of volume and a matte finish with very light hold, but unless you use an absurd amount of product it just doesn't hold. Careful with trying it since they obviously (or not) do NOT except returns.
customer_reviews.author: buyer12

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product for guys with straight, thin hair. I couldn't find the right amount to put in my hair. It was either not enough or way too much. Absolutely zero hold to it. I'm definitely sticking with a firmer molding cream from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost worthless
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the weakest clay I have ever used. Such good reviews for some reason. Maybe I got a bad batch or something. I have 6 inch hair undercut and after this is applied, damp or dry, it just falls down the side of my head and doesn't harden or strengthen at all. Just makes my hair feel greasy. How do I go about getting a refund on this AND the "high hold" cream I also ordered?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Not strong at all. Waste my money and the product cannot be returned. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE BEST FOR THICK HAIR
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this because i didn’t really see reviews on how this product holds with thick hair. I’m here to tell you that this isn’t the best product for thick hair. I have thick long (5-6 in) hair and this product just couldn’t hold it, even though it says strong hold. The hold lasted for maybe 15 min then it was like i hadn’t put anything in. I tried the clay, the cream and the fiber but none of them really did the trick. The only one the kind of worked was the fiber. This isn’t a bad product but it just wasn’t for my hair type.
customer_reviews.author: Alonso Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Meh🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting something different and it was my first hair product since I just grew out my hair so I really wasn’t sure what to expect but I was just expecting something different. I’m sure if I used it differently or knew what I was doing I’d have been more satisfied. I feel as if my review reflects my lack of knowledge on hair styling products and not the products functionality
customer_reviews.author: Josh Kreider

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hold and smell
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible. It makes no sense that this is a top seller. The smell, just as the others noted, is really bad. I was hesitant to use it at first cause it smells like something industrial. The hold is just as bad as well. I have short hair right now and the hold literally goes away after 3 mins. I had to reapply cause I thought I didn't spread well enough but that was not the case. Definitely regret wasting my money on this...
customer_reviews.author: Winarti Triyono

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad, doesn’t hold well, too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Smells nasty, like an old, smokey house and chemicals. It doesn’t hold like you would expect clay to hold. I ended up buying a $3 tub of Suave styling paste that works much better and actually smells good. Too expensive for what you get
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: just the right amount of hold
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a product that gave hold while not looking greasy, this definitely fits the bill, apply a small amount while hair is still damp and i can quickly shape a tousled look on top to go with my new mid fade. Wife even used it and liked it when we were traveling and she had forgotten her Go to product,
customer_reviews.author: david Darst

customer_reviews.title: Good holding strenght but doesn’t spread properly as it’s too sticky
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sticky It has good holding strength but not satisfied as it’s very hard and sticky than usual
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Laximan Sawant

customer_reviews.title: If your blonde and don't mind the smell then its ok.
customer_reviews.text: Leaves white streaks unless you work the product in for a bit. The smell is terrible. No one is going to want to run their fingers through your hair. Wish I was rich so I could just trash it...gonna be a long 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Haag

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have short-medium length hair in an undercut and use this clay to style my hair. I've tried gels, pomades, waxes, etc. over the years that have all ended up being too greasy, shiny, etc. This clay hits just the right spot. Keeps a great hold using only a small fingertips amount of product, doesn't cause the hair to look shiny and comes right out when washed. With a bit of hair spray easily keeps form for the whole day, sometimes even keeps my hair looking the same throughout my workouts. Pretty good product, as of my review would be the 3rd time buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty good product, I live in an area with more rain than the rest of the country so I wish it was harder to wash out for that reason. It spreads easy but your left with little white clumps of the molding clay so you either have to pick them out or rub it more into your hair. One thing I like is how quickly it dries up and holds the hair in place. I'll definitely buy it again once I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Found a solution for unmanageable hair.
customer_reviews.text: I have unmanageable hair. This product applied with damp hair holds it in place for hours. But, you must apply a few layers. No hairspray needed. No hairdryer to heat the hair needed either. If there's wind, I brush my hand through my hair and it slides back into place. I have finally found a solution for my hair. Best of all, it doesn't make my hair crunchy, does not leave residue, and does not have an odor. So let me repeat, apply it to damp hair. Reapply until you get a few layers of the product. Then, head out the door.
customer_reviews.author: nartxela

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Very poor hold. It does not do the job at all for me. I used about a nickel size of product on the first day and a quarter size on the second day. It doesn’t hold volume. I style my hair up but this can’t hold my hair up. It flops down after an hour. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, no returns
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this clay is very dry and barely works, within 2 hours it is as if you never had anything in your hair. Tried to return it but the seller does not allow returns.
customer_reviews.author: Cb1900

customer_reviews.title: Goes on clean but not much hold
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something comparable to TIGI Wax in terms of hold and finish, but with less mess. This product goes on very clean and washes off hand easily. I like that part. But it takes a ton to get any sort of hold, and then the hold only last a couple hours before falling apart. Might be ok for thinner hair, but I'm moving on to something else for my thicker hair.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: All talk...
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointing hold. Poor performance from just a start time after application. The smell is also nothing to be desired. I would definitely look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: jonnyo814

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: In all seriousness, considering the humidity in south Florida, it is the only thing that works without either: A: Having to use so much I look like I'm trying out for the MamboKings or B: Not using enough and having it be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Really poor product. Doesn't deserve the high ratings.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product for an Asian with straight black hair. It simply does not stick whether it's dry or damp. Requires quite a handful of product before even roughly sticking. And even then your hair feels sticky and you'll look like a disheveled crazy person whenever the wind blows and your hair looks like a toupee. Smell is OK not terrible, but the application of it comes off as a white substance when you spread it all over your hair. I've tried many other products and this comes off as extremely difficult to work with when applying it and maintaining it throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: AsianHairDude

customer_reviews.title: Medium hold, not high hold
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 3 stars because it’s not “high hold” by any means; it’s medium at best. Smells good, goes on easy, but if you’re like me and have thick, coarse hair that you’re looking to tame, this may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: With all the options on Amazon I wasn’t sure what to go with, but I’m very happy with this. I wanted something that had a strong hold that was not shiny, and this is definitely it. What’s nice is it doesn’t have a nasty glue feel to it, it’s easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Christiaens

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is bad. When Applied dry
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is bad. When Applied dry, it provides absolutely no shape to your hair. When applied wet, at best is a a loose hold with a wet look that cannot be re worked. I purchased because it was a best seller on amazon, but am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good hold, not too noticeable
customer_reviews.text: I like this product as a way to keep my hair up without it looking overly shiny. It works better than anything I've managed to find in a store, and lasts throughout the day. Some people have mentioned a smell - I find it to be very neutral. I'm guessing that no fragrance is really added. It kind of does just smell like wet clay when you put it on. The faint smell immediately goes away. It also really isn't very hard to wash out - no issues there. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Malted_Mook
